channel.name: Has the max number of fields in an action changed ?

messages.content:
From what I previously knew and had tested some time ago the max number of fields in an action was limited to 100 fields.
But I am getting an error " Exceeded array maximum size (max 16 < got 17)" if my action type holds more than 16 fields.
Was it 100 fields for Events or Actions?
1 action with 100 fields or 100 actions within 1 field per account update
@Mario | Socialcap actions are lists of arrays of fields
IIRC
and the array is maximum 16 IIRC
so split it up into multiple arrays
https://github.com/MinaProtocol/mina/blob/5dcc6777f10c940aae446cbb7877ca20edf0dcd9/src/lib/mina_wire_types/mina_base/mina_base_account_update.ml#L93

embeds.title: mina/src/lib/mina_wire_types/mina_base/mina_base_account_update.ml ...
embeds.description: Mina is a cryptocurrency protocol with a constant size blockchain, improving scaling while maintaining decentralization and security. - MinaProtocol/mina

messages.content: there's no length max here though
https://github.com/MinaProtocol/mina/blob/5dcc6777f10c940aae446cbb7877ca20edf0dcd9/src/lib/mina_base/account_update.ml#L1100

embeds.title: mina/src/lib/mina_base/account_update.ml at 5dcc6777f10c940aae446cb...
embeds.description: Mina is a cryptocurrency protocol with a constant size blockchain, improving scaling while maintaining decentralization and security. - MinaProtocol/mina

messages.content: there we go
so it's a list of arrays of max length 16
you can always just make it a list of arrays of length one if you're not sure how to split it up
the limit changed to 100 about a year ago, maybe it didnt make it into the version of the protocol for the hardfork?
cc @gregor
Nah it's supposed to be 100
May be network dependent
Where does this error come from?
I don't know why it's implemented as a bounded type of length 16 :/
Annoying
I believe it is line 18762 of https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js-bindings/blob/main/compiled/node_bindings/o1js_node.bc.cjs
stack trace into the ocaml code would be more enlightening 😄
you get that when you run node with `--enable-source-maps `
@Mario | Socialcap
there's only one place where this error message is used in the code base
it's from the module for defining bounded types
ok not very surprising I guess
Test code in https://github.com/Socialcap-app/socialcap-anonymous-voting/blob/main/test/big-actions.test.ts using o1js 1.4.0
And results using `--enable-source-maps` in https://github.com/Socialcap-app/socialcap-anonymous-voting/blob/main/test/logs/big-actions.log
Thanks, we found out that the 16 element limit was left in this type by mistake
So it needs to be worked around for now
And will be fixed in the next soft fork I believe
I would believe this would be a hard fork, no?
Well, it wont affect snark though
Thanks @gregor  I already adapted my code to the new limitation, but the original limit was really useful.
useful?

Yes, useful. It simplied extending the state fields using actions. As an action type could contain up to 100 fields in the same action, it provided up to 100 extra fields for holding state. I know it is state that is in the archive nodes, but it can be accessed and used from the contract so it was really useful.
An example of how we are using it; https://github.com/Socialcap-app/socialcap-anonymous-voting/blob/8d0e20e565b8b7eff5f972a4da06e20708243289/src/contracts/credential.ts#L47
well I mean you can still do that?

Yes, but packing it into arrays of 16 fields adds extra code and needs mapping from the struct to the array of arrays. The initial implementation did this in a much more elegant and easy to use way. Also managing arrays inside the contract code is cumbersome and not dev friendly at all 😦
Did this 16 element limit ever not exist?
Really dont know. But I have used and tested action types with more than 16 fields before in Berkeley testnet and they worked ok.

But I dont think is a critical issue right now. If no one is complaining about it, it means this limit is not a problem for most actual use cases. I was trying to use actions to store some extra state, but I think the same may be achieved with the new experimental OffchainState.
right, offchain state also uses actions btw, so this finding limits the size of state entries to 12  🥹 (4 fields are used by it internally)
@gregor related to this, why even the 100 field limit?
Seems like a very arbitrary number.
Why couldn't you just 10x it?
cause then the proving overhead for snark workers would increase and that might hinder network performance i think
It shouldn't affect proving at all.
it deffo does in case of actions no? since the chain itself is the one computing the action state out of the emitted action fields
I would think that you only need the hash, and not the preimage, to calculate that.
Can't say for certain how it's done, but it doesn't _have_ to be in-circuit.

i think on a consensus level you probably have to check the preimage has been made available, since its what you need to roll up things later on - esp. if you emit 2 actions within one AU - if thats even possible
sounds like it could be but maybe @mrmr1993 or @nholland94 can shine more light into it
You cant verify that in the circuit though.
well through needing the preimage as circuit input you "can"
+ validating that on consensus level additionally to prevent any wierd behavior from BPs? idk

having it as a witness wouldn't help you with availability, since you don't have to make the witness "available", the node checks the preimage availability at the consensus level

events/actions preimage isn't part of the snark, so yeah I wonder too why can't we do 10x more actions
or even better pay for more actions and therefore have much more
that would already be a very usable DA layer, add sampling on top of that for light nodes and we are golden

but isn't that a pretty big problem on its own? The snark should reflect the state machine that is also enforced by the consensus 1:1. And if you don't check the actions against the hash in the snark, that's a inconsitency
bcs if you only input the hash, you don't guarantee it's availability
if it was part of the witness, it wouldn't guarantee availability anyways, only if it was part of the statement
the snark ensures only the correct state transition, not the availability, hence the whole Data Availability problem
